definition: to climb a wall/(fig.) to be unfaithful
to crawl/to climb/to get up or sit up
wall/CL:面[mian4],堵[du3]
variant of 牆|墙[qiang2], wall

sentences.english: They climb walls, leap off buildings and spy on enemies.
sentences.chinese: 它们会爬墙，能跳下大楼，还能暗中监视敌人。

sentences.english: I saw the boy climb the wall.
sentences.chinese: 我看见那个男孩爬墙了。

sentences.english: He tore a hole in his trousers climbing over the wall.
sentences.chinese: 他爬墙时裤子给扯破一个洞。

sentences.english: Last autumn leaves lie in the chancellorship in Berlin.
sentences.chinese: 德国，柏林，依恋在爬墙虎上的最后几片红叶。

sentences.english: Plant a Boston ivy beneath a great statuary.
sentences.chinese: 在一尊伟大的雕像脚下种一颗爬墙虎。

sentences.english: I saw the boy climbing the wall.
A lot of people ran away by climbing the walls.
Completely broken my dream that my dream for climbing with see the beautiful sea.
sentences.chinese: 完完全全打破了我想要在青岛爬墙看海的美梦。

definition: lit. to climb over the wall/fig. to breach the Great Firewall of China
to leap onto roofs and vault over walls (usually associated with martial arts)
to bore/to burrow/to crawl through a tunnel
to crawl/to climb/to get up or sit up
to pick flowers/to enter houses at night in order to rape women
to dig a hole
to peep/to peek/to act as voyeur
to punch a hole/to drill a hole/to dig a hole/to burrow
to swing (on a swing)
to do a martial-art squat
Boston ivy or Japanese creeper (Parthenocissus tricuspidata)
foot of a wall
with bare hands/unarmed/fighting hand-to-hand/freehand (drawing)
gecko/house lizard
to turn a somersault
to slip away/to escape in stealth/to skate
